page.title: 07Trade
page.content: The service industry sector is growing in the area with the establishment of a branch in Truro of the national company English Estates, and the movement of the judicial centre of Cornwall from Bodmin to Truro. The complete range of shops are available, from large department stores to small independent shops. In addition there are 8 Banks and 11 Building Societies, mostly all centrally based in two streets. There are also shopping markets. There is an Enterprise Board to help form small businesses and this has the effect of converting the black economy to respectability. There is a Community Employment programme which has helped 1,450 people to gain full long-term employment.
